bibl.title: Letter from Lillie W. Franck to Philip Showalter Hench, April 10, 1948

div1.p: Franck discusses secretarial work she has done for Hench in connection with interviews of Lawrence Reed, Kean, and Ireland.

div1.head: Letter from Lillie W. Franck to Philip Showalter Hench, April 10, 1948
div1.opener:
check
sent
5/6/48
Mrs. William R. Franck
1237 - 18th Street, N. E.
Washington 2, D. C.
April 10, 1948
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Dr. Hench:-
div1.p:
Replying to your
letter of February 17, you
are quite correct that I did
not send you a bill, What
I was concerned about when
I talked to General Kean
was whether the manuscript
I sent reached you at the
time you wanted it.

On May 11, 1946 you wrote
me that you expected to
be in Washington the first
week of June to interview
Generals Kean, Ireland and
Reed. In the meantime
you had sent some questions
for General Kean, and asked
me to go over and take
the answers, which I did
on Saturday, May 25th.
When you came in June
we spent an evening at
General Kean's, but at that
visit you did not interview
Generals Ireland or Reed in
my presence.

I mailed the first manu-
script promptly. It took a
little longer to get the
interview with General Kean
written, as he wanted to
read it our first. In the
meantime I had mailed
the second manuscript by
special delivery. After receiving
a letter from you saying you
would like to have it before
you left for a trip to the
West Coast, and I was quite
concerned as to whether it
had reached you in time.
